There, he found a mound of treasure
from an ancient civilization, as well
as a small dragon sitting atop the
pile.

那里遗留着堆积成山的
古代文明的财宝。
“你来我的王国有什么事？”

The dragon, a self-titled queen,
distributed the treasure to local birds
and beasts. This brought great joy to
the animals, who wished to build
glittering nests.

将财宝分给了
附近的鸟兽们。
想制作闪闪发光的巢穴的

自稱女王的龍族，
將財寶分給附近的鳥獸們。
這讓想要把巢穴裝飾得閃閃發亮的
動物們非常開心。

context.en_us:
＂What a waste!＂ muttered the man.
＂Those beasts can't tell the difference
between a copper coin and a ruby!＂
Indignant, he began to formulate
a plan.

「なんてもったいないんだ。
この<ruby><rb>獣</rb><rt>けもの</rt></ruby>どもにかかれば
<ruby><rb>光</rb><rt>ひか</rt></ruby>るものはみんないっしょ。
<ruby><rb>銅貨</rb><rt>どうか</rt></ruby>とルビーの<ruby><rb>区別</rb><rt>くべつ</rt></ruby>もつかないんだぞ」
<ruby><rb>男</rb><rt>おとこ</rt></ruby>は<ruby><rb>憤慨</rb><rt>ふんがい</rt></ruby>し、<ruby><rb>一計</rb><rt>いっけい</rt></ruby>を<ruby><rb>案</rb><rt>あん</rt></ruby>じた。

“真是暴殄天物。
对这群动物来说，
发光的东西不都一样吗。
就连铜币和红宝石也没区别。”
男子很愤慨，于是心生一计。

「真是暴殄天物。
對這些動物們來說
會發亮的物體都是一樣的，
他們根本分不出銅幣和寶石的差別。」
感到憤慨的男子心生一計。

context.en_us:
He spent days currying favor with the
queen, claiming he could put the
treasure to better use. Then he
loaded his pockets with as much as
he could and fled to a nearby town.

<ruby><rb>男</rb><rt>おとこ</rt></ruby>は<ruby><rb>小</rb><rt>ちい</rt></ruby>さき<ruby><rb>女王</rb><rt>じょおう</rt></ruby>の<ruby><rb>機嫌</rb><rt>きげん</rt></ruby>をとり
「<ruby><rb>自分</rb><rt>じぶん</rt></ruby>ならもっと<ruby><rb>財宝</rb><rt>ざいほう</rt></ruby>をうまく<ruby><rb>使</rb><rt>つか</rt></ruby>える」

男子取悦小小的女王，
花言巧语道：
“我能更好地利用财宝。”
他带着一些财宝，
逃去了附近的城镇。

男子費心取悅小小女王，
花言巧語地說著：
「我能更加善用這些財寶。」
他成功騙取了一些財寶後

Yet there was still so much treasure
in the castle! It seemed a shame to
leave it behind, so he traded what
he'd stolen for cheap glass balls and
food, then returned to the queen.

接下来该往哪里逃呢？

男子将一部分财宝换成

The animals were overjoyed;
treasure was lovely, but delicious
food was much, much better.
And they now had even MORE shiny
things thanks to the glass balls!

<ruby><rb>動物</rb><rt>どうぶつ</rt></ruby>たちは<ruby><rb>狂喜乱舞</rb><rt>きょうきらんぶ</rt></ruby>した。

动物们狂喜得手舞足蹈。

但美味的食物更好！
而且还多了很多

chuckled softly at the thought of all
the treasure he now controlled.

女王微笑着称赞男子，

女王笑著誇獎男子，
還任命男子成為財務大臣。
男子當然沒有拒絕的道理，
這樣一來
他就可以任意取用這裡的財寶了！

The man continued to pilfer treasure
out of the castle, bringing back small
presents each time he returned.
The animals sang the praises of the
queen and her minister of finance.

於是男子繼續把廢城中的寶藏
拿出來變賣，
然後再帶一些伴手禮回去。

財務大臣和女王的偉大作為。

The new minister was flabbergasted.
Born in the slums and raised in
chaos, he could not comprehend
how the animals lived without a
shred of suspicion toward others.

「いったいなんなんだ、こいつら。

“这些家伙

「這群笨蛋到底是怎樣啊？

＂I don't understand these creatures,＂
said the minister. ＂All I do is use them
for their treasure, yet they are always
so happy! It makes me feel like I am
the fool and not them!＂

他們毫不懷疑他人的單純

It didn't take long for the minister to
gain fame among merchants. He
amassed uncountable riches, yet
always made sure to bring shiny
baubles back to the castle.

男子利用廢城的寶石做生意，
很快地就獲得了口碑。
在男子慢慢累積自己財產的同時，

「<ruby><rb>俺</rb><rt>おれ</rt></ruby>は<ruby><rb>女王</rb><rt>じょおう</rt></ruby>の<ruby><rb>臣下</rb><rt>しんか</rt></ruby>らしいからな」

Unfortunately, those days drew to an
end when an envoy of the region's
sovereign earl came to the
abandoned castle...

終於面臨了終結。
統治這地區的伯爵家
